member.name: M:Configit.Core.Utils.Serialization.ResourceRepository.CorePackageBuilder.CompleteAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously completes the package building and persists all resources added, making the package immutable. This method is thread-safe. The usage of CompleteAsync() is not intended for parallel execution and therefore enforces serialized access.
member.exception: If the package building is completed or aborted.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous complete operation. The versioned package Uri is returned in the value of the TResult parameter.

member.name: M:Configit.Core.Utils.Serialization.ResourceRepository.CorePackageBuilder.CompleteAsync(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Asynchronously completes the package building and persists all resources added, making the package immutable. This method is thread-safe. The usage of CompleteAsync() is not intended for parallel execution and therefore enforces serialized access.
member.param: A TimeSpan value specifying the maximum period for the operation to complete.
member.exception: If the package building is completed or aborted.
If the specified timeout period is exceeded.
If the specified timeout is negative or the number of ticks exceeds Int32.MaxValue.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous complete operation. The versioned package Uri is returned in the value of the TResult parameter.

member.name: M:Configit.Core.Utils.Serialization.ResourceRepository.CorePackageBuilder.AbortAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously aborts the package building and discards all resources added, making the package immutable. This method is thread-safe. The usage of AbortAsync() is not intended for parallel execution and therefore enforces serialized access.
member.exception: If the package building is completed or aborted.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous abort operation.

member.name: T:Configit.Core.Utils.Serialization.Serializers.SerializerLookup`1
member.summary: Lookup for serializers for (de)serializing objects implementing serialization through . The index is set up with a list of supported serializers of type that handles the serialization of type T. Each knows the serialized type name it supports, allowing the manager to build a mapping from say xml element name to serializer as well as from instance type to serializer based on the type parameter.

member.name: T:Configit.Core.Serialization.Helpers.BinaryStreamExtensions
member.summary: Extension to for reading and writing integer arrays as binary data. The size of each array will only take up as much space as is required by the largest element in the array.
member.remarks: The data an array will be packed in a 8,16,32 bit scale that matches the size of the largest element in the array.

By default arrays will be padded such that their offsets are multiple by the byte per elements. This is nessesary inorder to efficiently (without copying) read the data using javascripts typed arrays. The padding is done with 0s before the array. See: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Int32Array#Exceptions_thrown

Along with the data a header is written to the stream. The header contains 1) a byte reprenting the edianess of the data (1 is little, 0 is big) 2) a byte represented if the data is padded (1 it is padded, 0 is is not) 3) an int32 representing how many tables there are stored and a segment with offset (int32), length (int32) and block size (int32) for each array.
member.remark: NOTE: When Writing and Reading arrays the Endianness is the default Endianness used in .NET, can be retrieved with .

member.name: T:Configit.Core.Serialization.Helpers.BinaryStreamExtensions.Header
member.summary: Header stored before the data

member.name: F:Configit.Core.Serialization.Helpers.BinaryStreamExtensions.Header.Endianness
member.summary: Is data stored with Little Endian or Big Endian, when writing is used.
member.remarks: Stored in a byte for easy of implementation on the javascript side.

member.name: F:Configit.Core.Serialization.Helpers.BinaryStreamExtensions.Header.Padded
member.summary: Is data padded so offsets are multiple by bytePerElements. Data needs to be padded for the javascript side can use buffer as is, without copying data into other structure.
member.remarks: Stored in a byte for easy of implementation on the javascript side.

member.name: F:Configit.Core.Serialization.Helpers.BinaryStreamExtensions.Header.ArrayCount
member.summary: How may arrays are store in datablock

member.name: F:Configit.Core.Serialization.Helpers.BinaryStreamExtensions.Header.Segments
member.summary: Information about each array segment in stored

member.name: T:Configit.Core.Serialization.Helpers.BinaryStreamExtensions.HeaderSegment
member.summary: Represents parts of the header which describes the bounds of an array

member.name: F:Configit.Core.Serialization.Helpers.BinaryStreamExtensions.HeaderSegment.Offset
member.summary: start offset of sub array

member.name: F:Configit.Core.Serialization.Helpers.BinaryStreamExtensions.HeaderSegment.Length
member.summary: Length of sub array

member.name: F:Configit.Core.Serialization.Helpers.BinaryStreamExtensions.HeaderSegment.BytesPerElement
member.summary: How many bytes are used to store one item

member.name: M:Configit.Core.Serialization.Helpers.BinaryStreamExtensions.WriteArrays(System.IO.Stream,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32[]},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Write all to as binary data.

remarks.para: How many bytes used to store an int in each array are determined by the parameter.
The must match such that the first value determines the number of bytes to use for storing in the first array.
if is omitted it is calculated by finding the max value for each array in .

member.remarks: By default arrays will be padded such that their offsets are multiple by the byte per elements. This is necessary in order to efficiently (without copying) read the data using JavaScripts typed arrays. The padding behavior can be turned off by supplying false to the argument

member.name: M:Configit.Core.Serialization.Helpers.BinaryStreamExtensions.WriteArrays(System.IO.Stream,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32[]},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Byte},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Write all to as binary data.

remarks.para: How many bytes used to store an in in each array are determined by the .
The must match such that the first value determines the number of bytes to use for storing in the first array.

member.remarks: By default arrays will be padded such that their offsets are multiple by the byte per elements. This is necessary in order to efficiently (without copying) read the data using java scripts typed arrays. The padding behavior can be turned off by supplying false to the argument

member.summary: Read arrays that was written with WriteArrays method

member.summary: Collect header infomation for iarrays.

member.name: M:Configit.Core.Serialization.Helpers.BinaryStreamExtensions.GetPaddings(System.Int32[][],System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculate offsets for arrays in , offsets are padded such that they are multiple by the that matches the data.
member.remarks: Padded offsets are necessary in order to use the JavaScript typed arrays (Int8Array, Int16Array and Int32Array) to access data in buffer without copying.
